content.description: Small hold but great stances leave a rest whenever its needed. Climb up a fin of rock in the uphill side of the gully left of the Matterhorn.  After clipping the first bolt step left to the face and continue for some mellow moves.
Climb the seam to the right of Fire Breather and left of a small tree. A long reach at the start leads to very fun 5.10 climbing to the top.
content.location: Look for the obvious seam to the downhill side of Fire Breather.

content.description: Crimps to the third bolt yield themselves to a jug haul before the crux bulge near the finish.
content.location: First/most uphill route on the Spotted Owl Wall.

content.description: Slim holds and a crux start lead to some marginal pockets at on steep terrain. Bigger pockets may appear..or disappear. Use them to pull into the slab and finish on the arete/awesome flake features above.
Climb the left side of the arete.  Closely spaced bolts protect a fall from landing you on the slab behind you so watch the z-clip and be aware,
content.location: Furgedabowdit sits in the chute on the uphill side of the Matterhorn just around he arete from the afore mentioned climb.

content.description: Steep face climbing leads to a fun bugle before easier climbing to the anchor.
content.location: second route downhill of the Matterhorn climb.

content.description: Start up a good face to clip a hight bolt.  Good edges and a couple nubbins appear when you need them.  Technical climbing up the face is about as good as it can get into the high crux moving past the last bolt.
content.location: Obvious Matterhorn feature downhill of the chute on the Spotted Owl wall.  Climbs the face to the pointed top.

content.description: Climb a ramp up the left side of an arete.  Tricky start followed by holds whenever you need them.
content.location: Just uphill of the Winters End arete.

content.description: Good face/slab climbs ranging from 5.10-5.11 even a few 5.7-5.8 routes exist.  Home of the Oregon classic Matterhorn 5.10a.
